note.p: [Introduction to be linked as a separate html page]
17th year of Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ = 779. Hoernle, 1901, pl. vi, no. 1. Cf. SI M52 (year 20), P103.53.

q.l: @ salī 10 7 māśtä skarhvārä haḍā 5 hvaṃnä rruṃdä viśaʾ vāhaṃ ttäña beḍa siʾ pīḍakä

ttye pracaina cū āOr: ā[ṃ]. sīḍakä naḍau nāsti kṣīrūrū very similar to ū, but rū has right diacritical lower than ū, which has it touching the top of the letter. kīrä vī haṃtsa ūci śaṃdye jsa ci burä nvā sa-
lī pyaṃtsāṣṭa kṣīrū hir[ä] pajīde sīḍakī heḍä pharākä bakä caṃdä pajīde u ci va vā-
ra maṃgāra ṣaṃga ʾīde ttyāṃ brīyāsi u budarśaṃʾ chīyā yanīdä sīḍakä va gvārä näśtä
u vaña brīyāsi ceṃgāṃ js[ā]rä hamayä hauḍä khu vā nauha salye bisai jsārä ttū sīḍakä he-
ḍä u brīyāsi bīḍä hamayä dä u cvai varāṣṭa pamūhi tsī ttū-t-ī sīḍakä yīdä u bi-
salū nä nara[ṃ]dä himi 30With -e!? haḍā vī narą̄mi ci vā trraṃdä ttī ra ṣiʾ pīḍakä prąmāṃ hi-
[mi] khu hā brīyāsi u budarśaṃʾ haṃguṣṭi viśtārä brīyāsi | haṃ | gu | ṣṭä
ttä burä vara byą̄na ya budarśaṃʾ | haṃ | gu | ṣṭä
puñargaṃ || ci vaña ustaṃ brīyāsi jaṃpha himāde budarśąʾ-n-ī hā chīyā yīdä sī-
khauśpaṃ || ḍakä va gvārä näśtä puñargaṃ | haṃ gu | ṣṭä

q.p: (1) Year 17, 5 days of the month of Skarhvāra, of the king of Khotan Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ.

At that time this writ (was made) (2) for the following reason: Sīḍaka is getting a man for *official work together with water and ground. However many years accordingly they request any *official matter (3) in the future, Sīḍaka provides it, (whether) much (or) little—as much as they request. And whatever (4) old ṣaṃgas (of grain are) owed—Brīyāsa and Budarśaṃʾ keeps the account of them. Sīḍaka has no dispute there.

(5) And now Brīyāsa has delivered grain to the Chinese himself. And when—the grain at the top of the year—Sīḍaka delivers that, (6) and (= then) Brīyāsa will himself bring *that much. And whatever clothing goes to (= is sent to?) him, that Sīḍaka does for him, and (7) no bisalū will have gone out. (In/for?) 30 days that goes out which has come in.
And this document will take effect [when] (8) Brīyāsa and Budarśaṃʾ place (their) finger(s) [on it].
(9) The following were the witnesses: Puñargaṃ, Khauśpaṃ,Also in SI M52.2, 7, P103.53.2 (Emmerick). Hatkaṃ. — Budarśaṃʾ’s finger, Puñargaṃ’s finger.
(10) Now, whatever may be the *complaints of Brīyāsa, in the future Budarśaṃʾ keeps the account of it for him. (11) Sīḍaka has no dispute there.

note.p: 11th year, i.e., of Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ, year of the tsīṣīs (also Hedin 45) = 773. Hoernle, 1901, p. 37. The scribe was forgetful of his subscripts.

q.l: @ salī 10 1 māś(t)ä cvātaja haḍāʾ haṣṭa tsīṣīyyāṃ salya
ṣi pīḍaʾki ttye pracaina cu āṃ puñārrjāṃ ganaṃ nāstä
hauda kūsa puñargaṃ hīveī-ī above -e. ye khaysaṃmaṃji jsa u ttāṃ-
jeri māś(t)ä thau heḍiʾ pęʾmīnai śūdasä chā buys(d)eCf. Or.11252/37 a4. u
drraiśa chā dva tsuna hvāneFor hvāte, cf. Or.6399/2.6 khu sīḍaki thau byęhī. Vowel tops neither quite typical of -ai nor like -ę in pęmīnai. ttāṃ-
jeri māśtä u ni b(y)ehī-t-ī paṃ-māśtä śoLike śä, but no space for -au below ki. chā ysaṃthä he-
ri tī ri ṣiʾ pīḍaki prąmā hämi khu hā puñārrjāṃ haṃ-

q.p: (1) Year 11, eight days of the month of Cvātaja, in the year of the Tsīṣīs.

(2) This writ is for the reason that PuñārrjāṃPuñārrjāṃ and Puñargaṃ are both mentioned in a list of recipients of large sums of money in SI P 103.36, dated in the year of the ṣṣau Ṣacū (= Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ’s16th or 17th). Puñārrjāṃ is mentioned in D.viii.2 (IOL Khot 3/5) and SI P 98.10. Puñargaṃ is mentioned several times in BL and SI docs. According to SI P 103.6 he comes from Gaysāta. is getting wheat (in the amount of) (3) seven kūsas—it belonged to Puñargaṃ—from the khaysmaṃjā.The meaning of this term, which occurs several times, is not known. In Or.8211/1456 dvī khaysmaje “two khaysmajās” are mentioned. And in the month of Ttuṃjārā (4) he will deliver cloth: woolen (cloth) 11 chās in length and (5) 30 chās 2 tsunas in width, so that Sīḍaka receives the cloth in the month of Ttuṃjārā. (6) And if he (Sīḍaka) should not receive it, (then) for a five-month period he (Puñārrjāṃ) shall pay one chā interest.
(7) And this writ will take effect when Puñārrjāṃ (8) places (his) finger on it.
(9) Puñārjāṃ’s finger (mark).

msIdentifier.idno: Or.6393.1: KT V, p. 1 (2); SD II/XXV; SD, TV, p. 52

note.p: Report from Vaśäʾrapāña and Arrjāṃ to the spāta Gaudaka. The spāta Sīḍaka, Vaśaʾrapuña, and Gaudaka are mentioned together in Or.6396/2 from (Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ’s) 19th year = 781. Hoernle, 1901, p. 37. PLATE 5c.

q.l: @ aysi vaśäʾrapą̄ñä u arrjāṃ spāta gaudakä śaṃdā haṃbujsai haṣḍi yani
a ttanvī vī pūri paśāteṃ paṃ-ysārä mūri dvī ysāri mūri ttä dāśeṃ byehi
u drrai ysāri ttä ni dāśeṃ byehi kh[u] ttą̄ vaña spāta sīḍaki hīśtä ttä mūrä
ttyena paphūji na-ṃ haḍä hā haur[a] kuṣṭa-ṃ spāta jī ā c- -ye vīra-ṃ haʾci
nāsāte tta ttanvī gvaṣcą̄ñä himāri mūri haura pīḍakä tta x biysaṃji
u mūri ni haure ttī cäkvakä spātana paphūji ttī ra prąmāṃ himä khu hā [x]

q.p: (1) I, Vaśäʾrapuña, and Arrjāṃ embracing the earth (before) the spāta Gaudaka make a report:

(2) I sent (my) son to TtanvīB. takes this to be a noun meaning “hostage” or “pledge.” for 5,000 mūrās. 2,000 mūrās—those I have received in full, (3) and 3,000 thousand—those I have not received in full. When now the spāta Sīḍaka comes to you, those mūrās (4) you collect from him (Ttanvī), (but) don’t give them (yet) to (Sīḍaka). Where the spāta Jī has ... them(?) ... he will take whatever I have(?). (5) Thus Ttanvī is to hand them over,B.: “distribute,” but contexts seem to indicate “hand over, get rid of,” in accordance with the Buddh. terminology, where gvaṣṭ- is “separation”; SI P 103.43 has puṣa gvaścarä pāra-vaysdāṃ, which Emmerick translates as “Hand out (receipts for) the quittance of the debts.”(and then you) give (pay) the mūrās (to Sīḍaka).
Thus (first) you obtain the writ (from him) (6) and do not give (him) the mūrās. Then you shall collect the boySee Studies III, p. 56. from the spāta.
And it will take effect when (7) he places (his) finger on it. — (8) Arrjāṃ’s finger.

msIdentifier.idno: Or.6393.2: KT V, p. 2 (3); D II/XXV: SD, TV, p. 52

note.p: Regnal year of Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ, year of the ṣṣau Ṣanīra. Buttąnaka is mentioned in docs. from (Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ’s) 20th (Or.6397/1 = Hoernle 7) and 21st (Hedin 4) years = 782-3. Hoernle, 1901, p. 37. PLATE 5b.

q.l: [x x x x] śā māśti kaja (ha)ḍā 20 2 hvaṃnä rrāṃdi väśaʾ vāhaṃ ṣṣau ṣanīrä salya ṣä pīḍa-
[ki ttye p]racai[na c]ä āna sīḍakä śaṃdā geṃdi darmapuñäna veṃgulāṃ vī braṃgāna
[x x x x x x x x x] kūsi śau kha 5 u thaunakä śau hauḍä darmapuñä nāte sīḍa-
kä u kapāysä dva thaṃga nātä mī sīḍakä tvā śaṃdā kṣä-vāśaʾra ṣṭāṃ khuai śā kara käʾstä
īdi cä bāḍä vā darmapuñä āʾysaṃ himāte u thau kapāysä śaṃdā vā uysgeṃde sī-
ḍakī nä āhī īdi ttī ṣä pīḍakä prąmāṃ khu hā darmapuñä haṃguṣṭä viśtä bye pa-
rramai battąnakä bye japāṇakä bye birgaṃdarajä surgāṃ | darma | puñä haṃ | guṣṭi

q.p: (1) [Of the -th regnal year] of Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ, king of Khotan, of the month of Kaja 22 days, in the year of the ṣṣau Ṣanīra.

This writ (2) (was made) for [this] reason that: Sīḍaka buys ground from Darmapuña in Veṃgulāṃ *from Braṃgāṃ (3) [... owed?] one kūsa 5 khas and one piece of cloth. Darmapuña has delivered. Sīḍaka has received (the land) (4) and two thaṃgas of cotton. Thus Sīḍaka has received this ground.

For a period of 6 autumns, if he has cultivated (only) one plot,B.: “if he makes the one field (?) to be planted” (SD, TV, p. 52, cf. p. 57); cf. Or.6397/1.5 kīra käʾstä īdä. (then) (5) whenever Darmapuña has millet and cloth (and?) cotton he shall buy back the earth. Sīḍaka (6) can not *hinderCf. LKhot. āhrrī < āhalj- “to control” (SD, TV, p. 57; Studies I, pp. 25-27)? him.
This writ shall then take effect when Darmapuña places his finger on it.
Witness: (7) the parramai *Buttąnaka. Witness: *Japāṇaka.Japāṇaka- Or.6395/1.17, SI P 137.2.1, etc. Witness: Surgāṃ from Birgaṃdara.
Darmapuña’s finger.

msIdentifier.idno: Hoernle 2: KT II, p. 65 (26); SD II/XXVI; SD, TV, p. 52

note.p: Order from the ṣṣau Phvaiṃ-hvuhi to the spāta Sīḍaka of Gaysāta (also SI P 94.24, 100.9). Hoernle, 1901, pl. vii, 1, no. 5. In KT V, p. 2 (4) and SD, TV, p. 52, this is referred to as “Or.6394.1” and “Or 6394,1 = H2.”

q.l: @ ṣṣau phvai-hvuhi tta parī gayseta spāta sīḍakä vara u ttyāṃ hvaṃ-
ḍāṃ vara cu pīęmīnā thauna puḍaṃda u thauna ni hauḍāṃda vañau va mara hārū są̄made u
hattäkaṃ mūri jistādä dasau ysācya drai-se ttyāṃ mūryau jsa kāṃha thaunaka gvaṣcāṃdä
drai-se paṃ-saya pęʾmīnai-y-ūṃ jsa thau gvaṣceṃ dirsä chā khu parau pvīrau tti mū-
ri haḍā haṃgi puṣa hauḍa haṃtsa ysaṃthina khu śau dva na ni dāśīdä himye
ttāṃjerä 10 mye haḍai ttā parau tsve SIGNUM

q.p: (1) The ṣṣau Phvai-hvuhi orders thus: To the spāta Sīḍaka in Gaysāta and to those men (2) who promised wool cloths and did not deliver the cloths.Cf. the situation in SI P 103.35, also about delivery of cloth. Now, here for *you the merchant Są̄made and (3) Hattäkaṃ requested 10,300 mūrās. For those mūrās they (= those men?) had handed over 300 pieces of hemp cloth (4) worth 500 [= 15,000?]. I have handed over from them (?) thirty chās of woolen cloth.
When you hear the order, (5) at the expiry of the days, pay the mūrās fully together with interest. If they do not (pay) in full one (or) two it is OK.
(6) The order went out *to you on the 10th day of Ttuṃjārā.

msIdentifier.idno: Or.6394.2: KT V, p. 2 (5); SD II/XXVI; SD, TV, p. 53

note.p: Order from the spāta Ṣṣanīraka to the haṃdasta Sīḍaka in Gaysāta regarding payment. The similar document SI P 103.40 mentions the year of the ṣṣau Ṣacū (= 778-9), and SI P 103.41 mentions a *Sogdian (sūlī). Hoernle, 1901, p. 38.

q.l: [@] spāta ṣṣanīrakä tta parī gayseta auva-haṃdastä sīḍa-
[ki va]ra tvī tta kamalaji mūri ṣṭārä cu vārä u ysumą̄ña-vrrahaunajāṃ thaunāṃ
hīye u tti mūri kaji māśtä haṃdara-prū ṣṭāṃ pajistāṃdi u aysū sūlyä
jsa ysaṃthaḍä jisteṃ vaña ma sūlī ā khu parau pvaʾ tti mūri 9000 300 70 haṃ-
[tsa] ysaṃthina mara ājuma sūlī āṃ ttā ni jsāte khu paṃjvā haḍvā tti mūrä
[ma?]ra ni ājume paʾjs-e phauʾva hvera himārä haṃdyaji 6 mye haḍai ttā parau

q.p: (1) The spāta Ṣṣanīraka orders thus: To the haṃdasta Sīḍaka in Gaysāta:

(2) Thus you owe x mūrās per head as well as those for cloth for winter clothes. (3) And those mūrās they requested in the month of Kaja in the Inner Fortress. And I requested them from the *Sogdian (4) with interest. Now, the *Sogdian has come here. When you hear the order bring here those 9,370 mūrās (5) with the interest. The *Sogdian is not going to you. If you do not bring those mūrās here within five daysCf. SI P 103.42 paṃjvā haḍvā ma thaṃgä ājimyari “bring the tax here within five days!” (6) you will have to eat (= suffer) strong penalties.Chin. phau, see Intro. Cf. SI P 93.5 [paʾ]jsa phauʾva byehi, SI P 94.4 X[...] ājume phauʾ-v-e parī hauḍä.
On the 6th day of Haṃdyaja the order (7) went out to you.

msIdentifier.idno: Or.6395.1: KT V, p. 3 (6); SD II/XXVII; SD, TV, p. 53

note.p: Doc. concerning *tax-collectors (thaṃgaurāṃ pīḍaki?). 22nd year (of Väśaʾ Vāhaṃ = 789). The doc. contains provisions for sickness and loss of salary(?), but because of several lacunae and unknown words the sense of many of the provisions escapes us. Hoernle, 1901, p. 39.

q.l: [@] salī 20 2 māśtä skarihvāri haḍā 20 3 ṣiʾ thaṃgaurāṃ pīḍaki ttye pra-
[cai]na cu āṃ vikausa hīvī paysā brātari paśä thaṃgä vīra paṃ-ysā-
[ri] mūri ttye pracaina cu vikausa paʾ sī[ña x] ñari mūri puḍi yyeOr.ysye (B.). kṣī-
x nāṃ[d?]i mī hamīḍaka gaysātaja auya [tt]ū [m]ū[pa]datä thaṃgä
vīra paṃ-ysāri mūri dasau māśtä u auya ttu mūpadatti varā-
[ys- ?] v- nāṃdi thaṃgä vīra cu auva-haṃdasti spāta sīḍaki varāysai
[x] x -i auya ṣiʾ mūpadat[ä] hīya kṣ- x yä nyaṃdi thaṃgä vī-
ra khu āchinai hämāte haudai haḍā rrāśaʾ u buḍa rreysāte tī-y-īB.: drre spātetīyī.
[x] x x kīra vi[śt]ī[d]i u khauṣa u bīḍi tä [mū]padatä hamaiyi yaṃ-
di u cilai spāta yīdi śā khu ṣiʾ mūpadatä bisalyū narą̄mī
haḍā-kīrāṃ gārī bīḍi u auya nimāṃ yanātete corr’d from se (B.). mūrāṃ gārī ba-
rīdi tī rä ṣiʾ thaṃgaurāṃ pīḍaki prąmāṃ hämi khu hā vikausa u mūpada-
tä haṃgūṣṭi viśtāri u hamīḍa auya haṃgūṣṭi viśtāri ti bu-
ri va byą̄na ya bye spāta sudaṃ || bye spāta budesa || —
brrī | yyā | si | haṃgūṣṭi || || vikausa | haṃ | gū | ṣṭi
pu | ña | rgaṃ haṃgūṣṭi || || mūpada | ttä haṃ | gū | ṣṭi
mai | ya | datä haṃgūṣṭi japą̄ṇaB.: jaṣą̄ṇa. | ki haṃ | gū | ṣṭi
a | rrtai | haṃ | gū | ṣṭi || arsä | li haṃ | gūṣṭi

q.p: (1) Year 22, 23 days of the month of Skarihvāra. This writ concerning *tax-payers (is) for the following reason:

(2) Viṃkausa is sending his brother german in lieu of tax (payment of) 5,000 (3) mūrās because Viṃkausa had promised *SīñaCf. M.T. a.i.0033 (IOL Khot 41/1) paʾ sīña. of Paʾ x thousand mūrās. (4) And all the villagers of Gaysāta took on this Mūpadatta in lieu of tax (5) 5,000 mūrās (for) ten months. And the villagers took that Mūpadatta in varāysaiB. (SD, TV, p. 4) renders this word as “offer” in the combination kaʾrä varāysai “the offer of the gratuity,” but the expression kaʾrä N.N. in the wood tablets clearly contains the title and name of the scribe; see Studies III, pp. 39-40. ... (6) received for tax, which the village haṃdasta, the spāta Sīḍaka ... varāysai (7) ... (But?) this was Mūpadatta’s ... They *received as tax.

(8) If he becomes sick he has seven days’ jurisdiction. And (if) he *remains feverish more (than that) then for him (9) ... work ... and *Mūpadatta himself provides shoes and ... (it). (10) And the spāta provides one garment for him. If that Mūpadatta leaves *still owing work (11) (and) brings a *complaint for (loss of?) day-works and (if) he *disregards the villagers, (then) they shall bring a *complaint for mūrās.
(12) And this writ concerning *tax-payers will take effect when Viṃkausa and Mūpadatta (13) put their fingers on it and the villagers all together put their fingers on it.
(14) These were the witnesses: the spāta Sudaṃ, the spāta Budesa.
(15-22) Brīyāsa’s finger (mark), Viṃkausa, Puñargaṃ, Mūpadatta, Maiyadatta, Japāṇaka, Arrtai, Arsäla, Śalā, Jsajsaka,Jsajsaka is a dānapati in Hedin 23. Pheṃdūka, and Mahvetara’s finger (marks).

msIdentifier.idno: Hoernle 3: KT II, p. 65 (27) = Or.6395.2: KT V, p. 4 (7); SD II/XXVII; SD, TV, p. 54

note.p: Doc. concerning taxes dated in the 17th regnal year (of Väśaʾ Vāhaṃ = 784), year of the ṣau Ṣacū. The ṣau Ṣacū also appears in Or.6400/2.2 (no year) together with Pheṃdūka and Puñargaṃ and in Hedin 4 (21st year) together with Buttąnaka. Hoernle, 1901, pl. vii, 2, no. 8.

q.l: @ 10 7mye kṣāṇä ṣau ṣacū salya rrāha(ja) māśtä 10 7my[e] haḍai gaysāta-
ja auya cvātajä māśtū thaṃgä samauttāṃdä haurāka hvaṃʾḍä hä-
mya 50 5 thaṃgä ye paṃ-ysārä paṃ-se mūrä śe hva[ṃ]ḍy[e] mūrä 10 x
sa täña haṃkhīśaʾ ysāḍa hvaṃʾḍä 8 mara mūñaṃdā x x paʾjsa
hauparadärsä natca ʾau hvaṃḍä dasau haṃbaʾca hvaṃḍä hämya

q.p: (1) In the 17th regnal year, in the year of the ṣṣau Ṣacū, the 17th day of the month of Rrāhaja. (2) The villagers of Gaysāta have agreed on their taxCf. Or.6396/2.2; on samev- samautta-, see KT IV, p. 118. for the month of Cvātaja.

There were 55 paying men. (3) The tax was 5,500 mūrās, for one man 1,000 mūrās. (4) Only, in this count (were) 8 old men; here *dwelling ... (men) *in full strengthB.: “from Paʾ .” (were) (5) 37; ... men of the village (were) 10. All in all there were (6) 55 [= 8 + 37 + 10] men.

note.p: Vouchers issued by the spāta Sīḍaka dated in the 20th year (of Väśaʾ Vāhaṃ = 782). Hoernle, 1901, p. 39.

q.l: @ salī 20 māśtä rrāhaja haḍā 20 ṣi kṣau tye pracaina cu spā-
ta sīḍaki hārū suhadati hīvī kāṃjsa paphve
ttu cu va ʾau bāja mūri nāṃdi u nā mī ṣiʾ cirāṃ aśä-
ñai kūliSeparate -i (not li ligature). ttu kāṃjsa ṣaṃgäna dvāsi kūsa drrai ṣaṃga hyä-
ysdä nātä u gvīlāṃ tcyāṃ hīvī pāra svasūna kāṃjsa
*nātänāstä with another ta to the right of the subscript -y-. haudūsi ṣaṃga u thaunaka 4 tī ri ṣiʾ pīḍa-
ki prąmāṃ hämi khu hā aśäñe kūli haṃgūṣṭi viśtä

q.p: (1) Year 20, 20 days of the month Rrāhaja.

This voucher (was) for this reason that the spāta (2) Sīḍaka has collected the sesame of the merchant Suhadatta. (3) And the ttucus (?) took the mūrās instead of .... And so this Aśäñekūli from Cira received (it). (4) He received *in person the sesame by ṣaṃga: twelve kūsas three ṣaṃgas. (5) And Gvīlāṃ Tcyāṃ’s debt he took from Svasū (in) sesame: (6) 17 ṣaṃgas—and 4 pieces of cloth.
And this writ (7) will take effect when Aśäñekūli puts (his) finger on it. — (8) Aśäñai Kūli’s finger.

q.l: @ kṣā[ṃ]ṇ[ä] 20 mye salye hārū saleṃgari spāta sīḍakina
kāṃha thauna nātä drrairatcahauʾsi rrāhaji māśtä 20 6 mye

q.p: (9) In the regnal year, the 20th year, the merchant Saleṃgara received from the spāta Sīḍaka (10) 43 hemp cloths, on the 26th day of the month of Rrāhaja.
(11) And this writ will take effect when SaleṃgaraAlso Hedin 53b1, SI P 95.5, 9, 96.4. $$ puts (his) letter on it.

note.p: Doc. concerning taxes dated in the 19th regnal year (of Väśaʾ Vāhaṃ = 781), agreement between the spāta Sīḍaka and the villagers. Hoernle, 1901, p. 39.

kṣīrva-vīrai nva pravanai | śe hvaṃḍye mūrä pārrve 200 10 3 {8} u hālai hvaṃḍye 100Incomplete akṣara: upper left loop missing. 6 {4} mūri
mupadattä x x hvaṃḍyä 10 8 u hā{x}lai 7 Faint traces of akṣaras; what B. reads as himārä, looks more like x ñirā. 1000 500 {20 60 80}

q.p: (1) 19th regnal year, on the 29th day of month of Braṃkhaysja.

The spāta Sīḍaka and the villagers all together have assigned the court (2) tax.Cf. Or.6395/2.2. “Whole” paying men were 41, and “half-work” (men)hālairya is from *hālā-vīria- “half-work’er.” “Whole” men were “workmen”: Or.6401/2.2, M.T. i.17 (IOL Khot 44/5), D. v.4 (IOL Khot W 3), SI P 101.4 hālai hvaṃḍye ... kīrarai hvaṃḍye. 12 children and old men. (3) They (were) *Puñaupīkṣa, Jsajsaka, Gaudaka, Cauṣaka, Stavala, {ī x de}, Kāśaka, Svarrnadätta, (4) Vāysaḍa, Upadatta, Valai, Jigeṃḍai, Īrasaṃga, Jsaysayuda, Vaśaʾrapuña.

A “whole” man (5) on state-work accordingly had (the following) *scheduled (work):On pravanai, the meaning of which is not clear, see KT IV, p. 70. one man had to deliver 213 mūrās; and a “half” man 106 mūrās.
(6) Mūpadatta: 18 [“whole”?] men and a 7 “half” (men, which amount to) 1,500.
(7) Sābaka; 23 “whole” men and 5 “half-work” men, (which) amounts to 2,000 mūrās
(8) 433 mūrās

note.p: Note: The writing and reading of many of the numbers are uncertain and do not add up properly.

msIdentifier.idno: Hoernle 7: KT II, p. 66 (30); SD II/XXVIII (2); SD, TV, p. 54

note.p: Doc. of purchase (gärya-vāḍa) dated in year 20 of Väśaʾ Vāhaṃ (= 782), 3rd year of the ṣṣau Vädyadatta. Hoernle, 1897, pl. v, no. viii. In KT V, p. 5 (10) and SD, TV, p. 54, this doc. is referred to as “Or.6397.1” and “Or 6397,1 = H 7.”

q.p: (1) Year 20, 13 days of the month of Cvātaja, of this king of Khotan, Viśaʾ Vāhaṃ.

In the third (year) of the ṣṣau (2) Vidyadatta,Also dated in a year of the ṣṣau Vidyadatta are SI P 103.26 and perhaps SI P 93.3. (this) document of purchase (was) for this reason that Bugura bought three kūśeṃ (?) of earth from MaṃdūsaCf. Or.6401/2.3, Or.6402B/2.1. unmeasured (3) in *Gaṃtsakūḍai for a period of four autumns at the price of 1000 mūrās. The following are *co-terminous of that earth: (4) From the *water (it is) Puñavärṣa’s (land). From the ... (is) Sanekula’s man Kaḍaka’s (land). (5) ... if Bugura has not sown in his plot—if then Maṃdūsa within the four-autumn period (6) buys it back, he shall buy (it) back. Older (then that) it can not be bought back.
And this writ shall take effect (7) when Maṃdūsa puts his mark on it.
These were the witnesses: Witness Arsalaṃ. Witness the parramai (8) Buttąnaka. Witness *Bauḍa. Maṃdūsa’s finger (mark).

note.p: Doc. of debt (*pāra-vastū) dated in year 20 (of Väśaʾ Vāhaṃ = 787). Note the use of separate “double dots” in -ä. Lines 1-2 in Hoernle, 1901, pl. ii, 6.

q.p: (1) In the 20th year, on the tenth day of the month of Kaja. This promissory noteCf. Hedin 4.2 KT IV, p. 23 ṣiʾ pāra-vastū pīḍakä ttye pracaina [cu]. (2) (is) for this reason that Hvā Cai Sai had the (following) mūrās *outstanding. These were the ones (3) who requested the mūrās. He had promised Hatkaṃ 125 mūrās. He had promised the spāta (4) Sīḍaka 125. He had promised Pheṃdūka 125 mūrās, Alttāṃ (5) 125, Budarśaṃ 125, Mayadatta 125, Rruhadatta (6) he had promised [...]. (7) [If ...] can not deliver the cloths, then he [shall pay] interest (8) ... 100 mūrās.
Alttāṃ’s finger (mark), Pheṃdūka’s finger (mark), Hatkaṃ’s finger, Budarśaṃ’s finger, Rruhadatta’s finger, Jsajsaka’s finger.

note.p: Note special form of ra looking like ṭv! Hoernle, 1901, p. 38.

q.p: (1) In the month of Skarihvāra Hvurrä Dū delivered two cloths for garments. Afterward (2) he delivered one cloth, because he had sold barley.

note.p: Receipt dated in year 5, year of the ṣau Śāṃdatta, issued to the spāta Malārrjuṃ of Gaysāta.

q.p: (1) Year 5, 1x days of the month of Sijsīṃjsa, in the year of the ṣṣau Śāṃdatta.Cf. SI P 99.3, dated in year 4, the year of the ṣṣau Śāṃdatta. A Śāṃdatta is mentioned repeatedly in Or.11252 and Or.11344.

The spāta (2) MalārrjuṃA Malārrjāṃ is mentioned in IOL Khot W 1-2 and Ṣṣanīra son of Malārrjuṃ(?) in Or.9268A. of Gaysāta has delivered kūras for the amount of the debt, twenty thousanders, eight hundred (= 20,800). In that count (3) were *5,800 ... together with .... and together with Saṃganaṃda ... (4) ... he ... owed cloths worth 150 and two chās of woolen (cloths). ... (5) ... the debt ...

This writ is for this reason that Rruhadatta (3) had promised one ... but had not delivered. Now him (4) ... ten chās.
And it will take effect (5) [when Rruhadatta] places (his) *finger [on it]. Rruhadatta’s finger.

(8) [And it will take effect when] Rąmaka places his finger on it. (9) Rąmaka’s finger.

ysaujsa rraysga buśāṃja viysa upala kumuda sūmana caṃbāCf. Si 2.6(18); JP [38] (Si 12.11).

q.p: Thus I have heard, as (=when, how) the Lord Buddha formerly went in (his) career as far as the land of Vaiśālī; he stayed(?) in the Mrakāṭikā grove. 1.

(This) grove was very nice, pleasant, fragrant, very peaceful. There were nice dwellings of various kinds, just as was worthy of the Buddha. Springs, lakes, lotus ponds, pools, fountains, reservoirs (with) fresh water, cool, pure, tasty, quick(?), fragrant, lotuses, utpalas, kumudas, sūmana, caṃbā[ṭala ...].

note.p: II. Overlaps with Kha. 0013c7 (IOL Khot 8/7, different ms. with verse numbers).

q.p: Neither does he know it really in the middle, nor does he know it well(?) [...]. Therefore (he is?) very arrogant and [proud]. (91) Or always on that account because of folly ... one is confused [and becomes associated] Māra with his assembly binds the kleśas in saṃsāra(?). (92) He is bound to wife and ... He produces various ... desires ... and turns here in saṃsāra and does not know any escape. (93) Affection ... of beings ... Neither does he know how to reveal(?) the Law himself, nor does he recognize its correct meaning. (94) For he does not himself ... of/for the self ... I am—as far as I have the strength—able [to ...] what one ... of men ... (95) ... and so on of beings, who fall/go into that direction where now the evil-doing [fall among] among ghosts and animals ... (96) They remember the former ..., *merits, congratulations, ... sons, relatives they *send ... they go out (and) enter ascetic life.
Then the *Law ... said: ‘There are ...’

q.p: ... those men being ... of themselves ... become. They will fall into that drection, then, ... false roads (kumārga) in the end ... they will become horses (or) camels. (*99) They will carry burdens, they will load [onto them] many ... and they will not take pity on them. They will become very tired, exhausted, and *hurt, ... and distressed. 100

The Lady Dūlakā ordered (this text) to be written together with her son the knower of the Tripiṭaka, the monk Jayabhadra and together with her brothers, the spāta SīḍakaThe spāta Sīḍaka in Or.6393/1, etc. and the others, and with her sisters.

When they die there they obtain births among men. They become the servants of another and are very ... suffering in inferiority. (*101) When their human life is ended (of) at death they are able to hear the name, vows, puṇyas, and blessings of that buddha ..., (then) they make happiness, in (their) mind bliss [arises, their heart?] *rejoices, all are happy, they ..., they rejoice always. (*102) Then when ... respect great quickly they will obtain [deliverance] from all woes and sufferings, always they will obtain happiness ...

q.p: (r1) ... *lights, that buddha should be revered by him, (and) he will obtain birth as a man.
He whom it should please ... for birth after birth ... (r2) ... obtains ... (and) it should always be secure for him. That buddha should be revered by him ... (r3) ...

Thus ... spoke to him: Whomever it should please in his mind, he will be born in all ten directions, (r4) in Buddha-fields which (are) flawless. Or he whom far away pure, flawless buddha fields (should please), if, however briefly, (r5) he were to reach them, in just that way he must be revered by him. He whom a birth among the *Tuṣita gods pleases, where Maitreya (v1) dwells, in just that way it must be revered by him. He goes straight among the Tuṣita gods. As for those who follow evil false paths, if he has stayed away from [those], (v2) in just that way he must be revered by him, and he (shall) no more walk on false paths. He who has evil dreams at night or who (v3) ... a hundred kinds of confused, unfavorable signs, suddenly falls, or if a (v4) *ghoul [makes him miserable] (or) strength-robbing demons, (then) that Buddha must be revered by him, and they will not be able to harm him. (v5) He who (burns) in fire (or) drowns in water, who ... in ...

q.p: ... (r1) the stupa ... one should circumambulate it 77 times. And 77 times this (r2) dhāraṇī [and] mantra should be recited, and 77 times this dhāraṇī [and] mantra should be ordered to be written. One should be clean (and) well bathed. It should be written with great homage and while sitting in the middle of a well-cleaned maṇḍala. And the (r4) writer should give (be given?) a donation with seven jewels, and the writer should do homage with outstanding food and drink. And (r5) thus this kalparāja dhāraṇī should be written 77 times and be placed there in the middle of the caitya. Thus one should do homage (v1) to the caitya and clean it. What they do thus in that manner is expounded in this sutra.

The noble son or noble daughter whose life may be even completely destroyed (and) may have left *life, life comes back to him (or her), and he lives (v3) long, and he is delivered from all apāyas. And as for the previous āvaraṇas, on account of which he would have to go to an apāya, (v4) those are [extinguished?] for him. And for 77.000 lord buddhas (v5) [he will have accumulated] roots of goodness. [And] throughout (re)births he will be rid of all sins. And in all (re)births he *will be born remembering previous births.

note.p: Suv C 15.38-45; overlaps with SI M 13.14. Hoernle, 1897, pl. iv, no. iv (verso).

q.p: (1) Of the 24th regnal year, in the Year of the Horse, of the month of Hamārrīja on the 10th (2) day.

Baṃ the great Tcai-syāṃ had ordered: “What the bodhisattva (3) had ordered me to write here, (is) much ... (4) He ordered gifts to be given. Before the lord buddhas make confessions of sin (5) ... Saṃgaka, Kharūṣa,Kharūṣa also in IOL Khot 74/3 39v2 and elsewhere, see Kumamoto, 1991b, p. 69. and Paḍai. And thus all the way to(?) the saṃgha of Khotan. They (7) then promised to deliver puṇya-kuśala-mūlas to them. Accordingly(?), the teacher ...

q.p: (2-3) (I,) Hūyī Kīma Tcūna, give to you, the buddhas of the three times [...]. May (my) vows be completed!
Welfare! I go in reverence, (4) I revere—reverence!—to all the buddhas of the three times, the Law of the three Yānas, without remainder, (5) the four assemblies of buddhas:

mäśadye yāva śaräṇa satva pūñūda beysūñavūysā mista haʾ-

q.p: In the eastern direction (6) I revere Akṣobhya (and) the many billions of buddhas beginning with Mañjuśrī.
(7-8) In the southern direction I revere the exalted Ratnaketu together with his entire assembly, the first of whom is Ākāśagarbha.

In the western direction I revere (9) Amitāyu and a so numerous assembly there that one can not (10-11) obtain its number, those great bodhisattvas of the ten earths beginning with Lokeśvara are sitting in the ...—all of them I revere—reverence!
(12) In the northern direction I revere the exalted Dundubhisvara together with his entire assembly, (13) the first of whom is Samantabhadra.
(14) In the first subdirection—reverence!—I revere the all-knowing Buddha Dharaṇiṃdhara (15) the exalted one together with his entire assembly.
In the second subdirection (16) I revere the all-knowing Buddha Nārāyaṇa great in powers (17) together with his entire assembly.
In the western subdirection I revere (18) the all-knowing Buddha Candraprabha the exalted one together with his entire (19) assembly.
In the fourth subdirection—reverence!—I revere the all-knowing Buddha (20) Śāntendriya the exalted one together with his entire assembly.
In the upward (21) subdirection I revere—reverence!—the all-knowing Buddha Bhadraśrī.
(22) In the downward direction I revere the Buddha Vairocana together with his entire assembly.
As many (23) great beings, meritorious bodhisattvas (there are) in the world as far as ... (24) together with (their) entire assembly.

q.p: (25) Welfare! The twelve billions of lord buddhas called Ratnottama, (26) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The eighteen billions of lord buddhas (27) called Ratnaśikha, I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The eighteen billions of lord (28) buddhas called Ratnabhāsa, I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The twenty (29) billions of lord buddhas called Śamatha, I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The eighteen (30) billions of lord buddhas called Ratnabhāsaketu, I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
(31) The twenty billions of lord buddhas called Kāśyapa, I do homage to all of them. (32) Reverence!
The six hundred billions of lord buddhas called Vimalaprabhāsa, (33) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The ninety-eight billions of lord buddhas called Śākyamuni, (34) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The two hundred billions of lord buddhas called Vipaśyin, (35) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The two hundred thousand lord buddhas called Kauṭijña, (36) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The eighty billions of lord buddhas called Suprabhāsadharmottara, (37) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The five hundred lord buddhas called Prātāpana, (38) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The five thousand lord buddhas called Prādyauthau, (39) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The eighty thousand lord buddhas called Nāgottama, (40) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The five thousand lord buddhas called Āditya, (41) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The eighty thousand lord buddhas called Sālarāya, (42) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The eight hundred lord buddhas called Śamatha, (43) I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
The ten thousand lord buddhas called Prasannavadana, I do homage to all of them. Reverence!
All called (44) Utpalagandhakūṭa, I do homage to them. Reverence!
All in all (45) there will be four hundred billions *before eighteen lakhs seventeen thousand eight hundred buddhas.

q.l: cve ye nāma pyūṣḍi ṣaʾ na drrayvā avāyvā ysa-
tha na byehe na rä narye jsāve na prrīyvā na trruīśūʾ cve sāje
hvāñe samādauva jsa bāye ṣaʾ baʾysūśta jsa avīsadai haʾmi

q.p: He who hears their names will not obtain births in the three apāyas, nor will he go to hell or among ghosts or animals. He who learns them, (48) speaks (them, and) leads them with *instigation (sāmādāpā?), he will become a non-returner from bodhi.

q.l: namą̄ kṣaimākarä jasta beysa namasū ną̄da namau dvīyaśā bī(sai)
jasta beysa namasū ną̄da namau miysekā jasta beysa namäsū
ną̄da: namau mūrauca jasta beysa namasū nauda namau ränauma-
la jasta beysa namasū nauda namą̄ aparmata-gūṇa-rahnavyūha-
ja jasta beysa namasū ną̄da: namau sūvąrnātmä-
prrabhāsa-śrrī jasta beysa namasū: namau bahūvaidha-ttejā-rā-
namau gūṇa-kūsūmä-śrrī jasta beysa namäsū namau rru-
ja jasta beysa namasū: namau rājagrrāmai jasta be(ysa) na-
masū: namau kauḍau jasta beysa namasū: namau tcauvabanī
jasta beysa namasū: namau daittakābanī jasta beysa na-
mäsū: namą̄ aṣagarāja jasta beysa namasū namau khā-
hyepe vī bīsai jasta beysa namasū: namau brrūya bīsai

q.p: (49) Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha Kṣamākara. Reverence!
Hail! I do homage (50) to the lord buddha dwelling in Dvīyaśāya(?). (51) Reverence!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha Mūrauca. Reverence!
Hail! (52) I do homage to the lord buddha *Ratnāmala. Reverence!
Hail! I do homage to the tathāgata called Aparimita-guṇa-ratna-vyūha-(53)teja-rāja-kalpa.
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha Sahasra-megha-garjita-rāja(?). (54) Reverence!
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha Suvarṇātma-(55)prabhāsa-śrī.
Hail! I do homage to the tathāgata called Bahuvidha-teja-rāja-(56)śrī-nirbhāsa.
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha Asaṃkhyeya-kalpa-(57)koṭi-samudānīra-buddha-śrī.
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha Guṇa-kusuma-śrī.
(58) Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha (in?) Ruja.
(59) Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha in Rājagrāma(?).
(60) Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha in Kauḍau(?).
Hail! I do homage (61) to the lord buddha in Tcauvabana(?).
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha in Daittakābana(?).
(62) Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha dwelling in Khāhyepe.
(63) Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha dwelling in Brrūya.

q.l: namau cū ṣaʾ cū ttyau jastau beysāṃ nāma
sāje hvauñe śe beysa ną̄mä hvą̄ñą̄mi jsai kalpasthāna karma ba-
ś(d)eʾ jāre śeʾ ysatha jāsamarä haʾmi:

q.p: (64) Hail to him who (65) learns (and) speaks the names of those lord buddhas. By the speaking of the name of one buddha the karmas and sins of many aeons (66) are destroyed. In his second birth he will remember former births.

q.l: satva namasū: namau āryā-samattabhadha bhaudhasatva namasū: na-
mau baiṣąjarāya bhaudasatva namasū: namau āryāvalą̄-
kyedeśvarä bhaudasatva namasū: namau āryā-kṣadagarbä bhaudhasa-
tva namasū: namau āryā-vajrraräpauña baudhasatva namasū: namau
āśagarba bhaudasatva namasū: namau āryā-majūśrrī bhaudha-
sadha namasū: namau āryā-mą̄ṇabhāva bhaudhasatva namasū:

q.p: (66) Hail! I do homage to the bodhisatva Āryā-Maitreya.
(67) Hail! I do homage to the bodhisatva Āryā-Samantabhadra.
Hail! (68) I do homage to the bodhisatva Bhaiṣajyarāja.
Hail! I do homage (69) to the bodhisatva Āryāvalokiteśvara.
Hail! I do homage to the bodhisatva Āryā-Kṣitigarbha.
(70) Hail! I do homage to the bodhisatva Āryā-Vajrapāṇi.
Hail! I do homage to the (71) bodhisatva Ākāśagarbha.
Hail! I do homage to the bodhisatva Āryā-Mañjuśrī.
(72) Hail! I do homage to the bodhisatva Āryā-Māṇabhāva.

q.l: mau paiṇḍūra-bharädvāja sthīrä namasū: namau sarvāda-saida-śrrī
jasta beysa namasū: namau kanakava sthīrä namasū: namau
badrraika sthīrä namasū: namau pūrṇa-mitrrāyanī-pūtrra sthīrä
namasū: namau vanavāsa sthīrä namasū: namau barädvāja sthī-
rä namasū: namau cūḍāpattai sthīrä namasū: namau mahākāśa-
va sthīrä namasū: namau śāräpūtrra sthīrä namasū: namau rā-
hūla sthīrä namasū: namau sūbū sthīrä namasū: namau āgī-
ñą̄nakauṭī sthīrä namasū: namau bhāṣma sthīrä namasū: namau
āgīñą̄nakauṭīña sthīrä namasū namą̄ mahāmaudagalāya sthī-
rä namasū namau mahānāma sthīrä namasū

q.p: Hail! I do homage to the elder (73) Piṇḍurabharadhvāja.
Hail! I do homage to the lord buddha Sarvāntasiddhaśrī.
(74) Hail! I do homage to the elder Kanakava(tsa). Hail! I do homage to the elder (75) Bhadrika.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Pūrṇamaitrāyaṇīputra. (76) Hail! I do homage to the elder Vanavāsa.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Bharadhvāja. (77) Hail! I do homage to the elder Cūḍapanthaka.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Mahākāśyapa. (78) Hail! I do homage to the elder Śāriputra.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Rāhula. (79) Hail! I do homage to the elder Subhūti.
Hail! (80) I do homage to the elder *Ājñātakauṇḍinya. Hail! I do homage to the elder Bāṣpa (Vāṣpa).
Hail! (81) I do homage to the elder *Ājñātakauṭinya.
Hail! I do homage to the elder Mahāmaudgalyāyana. (82) Hail! I do homage to the elder Mahānāma.
The names of the 12 billions of lord buddhas and bodhisattvas and elders are completed.

q.l: namau sagāya namau dīśa diśaunau trraikṣadānau bādą̄nā
lą̄kyedāttaunau ttadyethā ʾauma būje abūje veräbūje
sarvabūmi rä būje garruṇḍa būje attaga būje sthvā
būje sarvakarmākṣīya sv(ā)hā namau pīsai baiśamaśvaräsye ka-
räsye ʾaidrrai ʾaidrrāyene svāhā: ttu sūtrra u baudasatvaB.: dāauda satva. hīye
nāmi ūMs. kū (B.). beysā hīye nāme hūyī kīma tcūna pasta pīḍe
beysūśta brrīye jsīnai hūṣī pīlai vyechīde tta ṣṭau pūña kūśa-
lamū(la) mistye rraispūrä jīnana habrrīhū ga-vaśeṣaʾ hamāve || ||

q.p: (Skt.:) Hail to the Buddha! Hail to the Dharma! (84) Hail to the Saṅgha! Hail to (all) the buddhas standing in the ten directions (85) in (all) the lokadhātus! Tadyathā [dhāraṇī] svāhā.

(88) This sutra and the names of the bodhisattvas and the names of the buddhas Hūyī Kīma Tcūna ordered to be written (90) in love of bodhi. May his life increase, his sufferings disappear! These merits and (91) roots of goodness I share with the great Prince Jīna. May it be a special gati!

note.p: Aparimitāyuḥ-sūtra. Ed. Konow, in MR.; Duan Qing, Aps. Guide² [18.3].
Homage to the buddhas, etc. Bailey, 1942, pp. 890-93.

q.l: || saddhama namau ratna-ttrīyāya ayse ra pīḍe hūyī ṣau kīma tcūna
tta ṣṭā ttā pūña kūśalamūla pajsa gi satvau habrrīhū || aysiʾ ra pīḍiṃ hūyi ttūtevä kīma tcūnä || ||

q.p: Welfare! Homage to the three jewels! I wrote it, Hūyī Ṣau Kīma Tcūna. I share those merits (and) roots of goodness with the beings in the five gatis. And I wrote it, Hūyī Ttūtevä Kīma Tcūna.

q.l: tta ṣṭāṃ ttā pūña kūśalemūla pajsa ge satvau jsa habrrīhū
aysai ra pīḍai hūyī ttūttevä kīma tcūnä || ||
saddham̱ tta tta mahu jsa pyūṣṭa śīña baʾḍa gyasta baʾysa śarāvasta āsta vye jiya ||
rraispurä bāśaʾ anātapiḍhī hārū sarkhyerma dvāśau pajsā mahāṣāvya jsa pharā-
kyāṃ baudhasatva jsa maʾstā baʾysuñavuysyāṃ jsa hatca ttaña baʾḍa mī gyasta baʾysa ||

q.p: Welfare! Thus I have heard. At one time, the Lord Buddha was staying at Śrāvasti, in the garden of Prince Jeta, in the saṅgrāma of the merchant Anāthapiṇḍika together with the twelve powerful mahāśrā-vakas, many bodhisattvas, many great bodhi-seekers. Then, at that time, the Lord Buddha.

q.l: || || ārāchana ṣṭāṃ ttā hūñāṃ *harbīśāṃMs. rhabīśāṃ. harbīśāṃ vā tcūrrvā
hāle daśvā dīśvāʾ ʾaunadvā sūmą̄ha jastą̄na jastą̄ beʾ-
ysa āspāva nāsāṃ se tta khu *sarbadyeMs. rsabadye. dīśaʾ hālaina a-
bīrada lą̄vadeva namą̄ akṣą̄ba jasta beʾysa: ravye pa
dīśaʾ jsa namą̄ rahnaketta jasta beʾysa ñūhūjsadye dyeīśaʾ
hāle namą̄ aramyāya jasta beʾysa hą̄da rai-
chāṃ hāle namą̄ daudavesvera jasta beʾysa u-
sakyą̄ṣṭa dīśaʾ jsa namą̄ badaśarī jasta beʾysa
nāṣṭa dīśaʾ jsa namą̄ āra verą̄ca jasta beʾysa cū
ra mara myą̄ña svahe lą̄vadeva rahnavyūhamaṇḍale vauña

q.p: (229) In ... we proclaim to you, all of you dwelling in the four (230) directions, the ten directions. We take (231) refuge with the buddhas, lords of lords, (sitting) in full view, such as:
In the eastern direction, in the world sphere Abhīrati, (232) hail to the Lord Buddha Akṣobhya!
In the southern (233) direction, hail to the Lord Buddha Ratnaketu!
In the western (234) direction, hail to the Lord Buddha Amitāyu!
In the direction of the Seven Ṛṣis, (235) hail to the Lord Buddha Dundubhisvara!
In the upward (236) direction, hail to the Lord Buddha Bhadraśrī!
(237) In the downward direction hail, to the Lord Buddha Āryā-Vairocana!
(237) And hail to him, the Ratnarāja, who sits here in the middle on the jewel lotus in the *temple of the Ratnavyūhamaṇḍala in the world sphere of *Sukhāvatī (240) surrounded by 20,000 bodhisattvas!

q.l: cakrravatta ttrraikṣada śākyamą̄na śāstāra jasta beʾysa
āspāva nāsā harabaiśa ttrraikṣa(da) bauʾdasatva araha-
da ṣāvā pyattīkasabauda saida vaidyādarä raṣaʾya
pajāba yattrra nva drraya rana beʾysāṃ dā śaha sa-
tva tta khu beʾsta ysāra baudasatvāṃ rāṃda ʾīde tta
tta khu āryā majaśūrī baudasatta āryą̄lą̄kye-
deśvara baudasattva namą̄ āryā-kṣadagarba baudasatvaLike dāauda°.
ysą̄ra bauda{da}satva narą̄da harabaiśa ttā sa ysāra sa
byūra jūna dī pākāṃ dī paśaunakyāṃ ą̄rga śaraṇā

q.p: Hail to Śākyamuni standing (here), the daśa-bala, (241) cakravartin, the teacher, the Lord Buddha — (242) we take refuge (with him).

May(?) all the bodhisattvas standing (here), arhats, (243) śrāvakas, pratyekasambuddhas, appear! — the vidyāntara(?) ṛṣis, (244) the pajābayattrra according to the Three Jewels, the Law of the buddhas ...., (245) such as, there are 20,000 bodhisattva kings, such (246) as: the bodhisattva Āryā-Mañjuśrī, (247) the bodhisattva Āryāvalokiteśvara, hail to the bodhisattva Āryā-Kṣitigarbha, (248) hail to the bodhisattva Āryā-Samantabhadra, hail (249) to the bodhisattva Āryākāśagarbha, hail to the bodhisattva Āryā-Vajrapāṇi, hail to the bodhisattva, (250) hail to the bodhisattva Āryā-Bhaiṣajyarāja — 20,000 bodhisattvas all have come out! 100,000, 1,000,000 times below their feet, below their ... in reverence we make a report, a vijñapti, of protection.

q.l: cū ra ttī mara kṣīra paramaṇḍa-
le hīye kāka nīvā{x}ysva devatta paravālā
ʾīde tta tta khu bīsa prrūva ysīmā ttala gaṇḍye śala-
ba ysīnī nāṃda ʾīye tta khu śakrra brrahamą̄na paḍą̄-
ysāña jsa tcą̄ra lą̄kapāle vrrīśama vīrrulai vī-
rrupākṣa dadarāja sañī pajī pajābeʾña sūmakī-
laha mahāyą̄na hrrabāsta āstana āda vai pai-
ṇḍūryerākadūmakettabauda brrahaspa śa śtu śama nai śa

q.p: (253) Whichever, then, here in the land, are the indigenous deities protecting the parimaṇḍala, (255) such as (those protecting?) the house, the watchpost, the ... (who?) (256) may have taken into (his/her protection) such as as those headed by Śakra, Brahman, (as well as) (257) the four World Protectors: Vaiśramaṇa, Virūḍhaka, Virūpākṣa, (258) Dhṛtarāṣṭra, *Samjñāya, Pajī, Pajābeʾña Sūmakīlaha ...

q.l: hą̄da ysā(ra) haṣṭa-se hauda paravālā ca vā ttu hva-
na kṣīra ysīnī nāṃda ʾīye cū ra ttī hą̄vana hą̄vana
jaśta ʾīde tta tta khu agūśaʾ sthą̄ną̄va śakhīma śa-
rīmā dīvye aśaukha cą̄mą̄ṇḍva hārrva reva daṣaʾ būma
dīvye katha dīvye kūṣḍi dīvye rāja dīvye jaśta āsta
cū ra ttī śaʾma būtta-rāja paḍą̄ysą̄ña jsa pūra ą̄rma-
ysdāna grraha nakṣatta {lī} salye bāyā {x} devatta para-
vālā ʾīde tta tta khu ną̄vauna rāṃda ʾīde nada upa-
nada sāgara grrahadatta ʾelapatta myacalena sū{x}-
mapauña ttaśattara būjsyaja ṣaṇīraka ssa nau kūle
hāvana hāvana pāraṣadā pāraṣadye ca ttā ną̄ma na
hvava ṣṭe cū ra ttī ga ʾauṇaḍvā devatta paravālą̄
aśtada ʾīye tta tta khu mahābala paravāle ca gara-
veysaña ysīnī pastai nāve gara-kūvā khāhvā ā-
ṣaijvā ttājvā bīsā devatta paravālā aśtada ʾī-
ye harabaiśa {x} vā namadrrūna parīye ahavā-

q.p: (261) 7,807 paripālakas, who may have taken into (their) protection this land of Khotan, who are those very powerful (263) goddesses, such as Agūśāʾ, Sthą̄ną̄vā, Śakhīmā, Śarīmā, (264) goddesses Aśaukhā, Cą̄mą̄ṇḍvā, Hāritī, Revatī, *Dṛḍhā, (265) the goddesses of the earth, the goddesses of the city, the goddesses of the palace, the goddesses of the *royal quarters, and the others.

(266) And those who are headed by Yama, king of ghosts, the Moon, the Sun, (267) the planets and the asterisms, the year-leaders, all these protecting deities, (268) such as the kings of nāgas: Nanda, Upananda, (269) Sāgara, Grahadatta, Elapatra, Mucilena, Saumapuña (270) ... Ṣanīraka.

109 billions (271) of very mighty gods and goddesses of the assemblies(?), whose names are not mentioned. And the protector deities who may be in the ..., (273) such as the mighty protectors who (274) have taken into their protection the mountain dwellers, the protector deities there may be dwelling in mountain ..., springs, lakes, rivers, .... (276) all (of you) deign to accept my invitation.

q.l: cū ra ttī mara kṣī(ra) vīśūʾna hīra pīla upadrrava
ʾīde tta tta khu śva tcą̄ma śalarba harabaiśa ttā naṣauʾ-
ma tsīde āchai ma na hamāve daurabaikṣa ma na ha-
māve dakhą̄ttaka satva hera-drrą̄mā hamāve ā-
chanakau āchai jsa pverāṣṭa hamāve śade ma raysa
sarabī satvā ma hą̄ra hadāra pīsa pyālye huṣa tsī-
de sadarma śāśaʾ dāra-vastu hamāve drraya ma rana

q.p: (277) And whatever evil things there may be here in the land, sufferings, miseries, (278) such as ..., ... locusts, may they all go to extinction. (279) May there be no illness, may there be no famine, (280) may it for suffering beings be like before, (281) may there for the sick be separation from their sicknesses, may the juice of the earth rise here, (282) may the generosity and care of beings here prosper and increase, (283) may the teaching of the True Law endure, may the Three Jewels (284) be honored!

q.l: || namau daśa-daśą̄nāṃ ttaikṣadaunāṃ baudaunāṃ lą̄gyadāttą̄nāṃ samnau-
|| namą̄ dīśa-dīśą̄nāṃ ttaikṣadą̄nāṃ bą̄thą̄nāṃ bągavattą̄nāṃ lą̄kanārthą̄nāṃ samanvā-
gattą̄ñaṃ tad-yathā būje abūje svārtha būje sarvārtha būje sarvakarmā āvarṇa

q.p: (285) (Skt.:) Hail to the buddhas standing in the ten directions ...

q.l: || ama yai maukṣaidra badaṃjsä tcarmä cīvara haṣṭai bīḍa pāste haiya
haya pā ṣai: śve ra mī ma yai
|| ama yai khara painä pyau khaurä samarai ttrvāyä pākai urä pauttai: śve
ra mī mayai {ra ma yai tte pīysä tte pīysai}
|| ama yai ʾejattūhaʾ dīvatte pīysä tte pīysai u kajakä kajakai
khāysa ttaujai u ttūra phalau śau ma na la pātta nai gyai kharai pūlą̄-
ñi gūhai: bīsa neruai śve ra mī ma yai
|| ąma yai arsa{na}lana tcą̄nai ttura būysai dastalaka dai tcajsa rūmai
nera hvąstai tcajsa thīyai mą̄rda hairttai śve ra mī ma yai

note.p: Skt. Sitātapatra on the back of Chinese Saddharmapuṇḍarīka (Giles no. 3164). One line Khotanese at end. Lines 49-96 on Ser., pl. CXLVII; lines 1-23 in Hoernle, 1911, pl. V facing p. 464 (“Ch.0041”).

Two texts starting from either end of the scroll. Kumamoto, 1996. Text a: Chinese-Khotanese phrasebook (Takata, 1988, pp. 203-4). Text b: letter draft. On the back of Chinese Saddharmapuṇḍarīka (Giles no. 2907).
Chinese expressions written in Brahmi followed by their Khotanese equivalent. Cf. Or.8212/162.

msItem.l: || śu ttama la: utca vā bara: kī pa tca hvanakhāysa vā pajsa: ttai ma tcīna
sūraka vā pajsabīka ñau tca lamaṇḍai vā kūśaʾ śā: va ṣī yau-
va śyai yaiva ra ṣī yīra: hairai kṣamī hairai hūrrū: yauva śa ma na:
aśtuau vai kṣaimai: caina ttama la: nama vą̄ bara: ttama hvana śī lakhā-
ysā vā bara: yama ttama lanamva vā bara: ba la: tsa vāpa lai yana
vā ā :: ī kha che hvana śau tturaka khaysa pajāysa: u ḍa kyaura
parya tta paryai: sū ttama lattaradya vā bara: bauvanaiśta ma: ana ḍa kha-
ra: kūṣṭau parī tsvai: śīʾ ba laparya sūraka vā pajsa vā ttraidai: tcīva ttama lamau vā bara

śu ttama la水擔來 (shuî dān lái) → utca vā bara: “bring water!”
kī pa tca hvana 急作飯 (jí zuò fàn) → khāysa vā pajsa: “make food for me!”

ttai ma tcīna → sūraka vā pajsa “cook sūraka for me!”
bīka ñau tca la 覔女子來 (mì nyû-zi lái) → maṇḍai vā kūśaʾ śā: “find me a woman!”
va ṣī yauva śyai yai vara ṣī yīra → hairai kṣamī hairai hūrrū: “whatever you wish I shall give”
yauva śama na要甚麼哪 (yāo shénme ne) → aśtuau vai kṣaimai: “do you wish anything?”

caina ttama la氈擔來 (zhān dān lái) → nama vą̄ bara: “bring me some felt!”
ttama hvana śī la 擔飯吃來 (dān fàn chī lái) → khāysā vā bara: “bring me some food!”

yama ttama鹽擔來 (yán dān lái) → namva vā bara: “bring me some salt!”
ba la 邁來 (mài lái) → tsa vā “come here!”
pa lai ya 不來也 or 已 (bù lái yê/yî) → na vā ā :: “he has not come”

ī kha che hvana一口吃飯 (yī kê? chī fàn) → śau tturaka khaysa pajāysa: “have a mouthful of food!”
u ḍa kyaura 屋里 (wū lî ...) → parya tta paryai: “please come in!”

sū ttama la蔬擔來 (sū dān lái) → ttaradya vā bara: “bring me some vegetables!”
bauva 無 (wú) → naiśta ma: “there is none here”
a na ḍa khara 阿那里去 (ā nâli qù),→ kūṣṭau parī tsvai: “where does he deign to go?”

śīʾba la入來 (rù lái) → parya sūraka vā pajsa vā ttraidai: “please enter!”
tcīva ttama la 酒擔來 (jiû dān lái) → mau vā bara “bring me wine!”

note.p: Beneath the text: @ bod-skad “(in) Tibetan”; further below, a Tib. text. Cf. IOL Khot S. 40 lines 13-19.

q.l: aga ṣṭau brrau jsa īnīda kaṇa ma bīysajīda ttī jsā ṣadyai valakyai brrai
pvaisa kaṇai dvīda : chaugalakai aga a ñū caistaka jīyaka khvai ṣa pā ma kaiṇa
dvīda vīnai na hamai : brrī va ttā tsvai ttāṣṭa ṣacū kīthāṣṭa gīhyara vā cai-
ga ttī jsā hva{tta}na khva vā byaihai pada : kamacū kīthāṣṭa ama jsā ttyai
gīsta jsa maista baiysūśta bvīryau : O || pharāka ya hvaṇḍa ttakyai
janavai vīra na ṣava basta aysamū habāḍa śā ṣavai aysmū va tvī bai-
da basta valakā paināṃ caṣṭā : vā ba brrīyā tta ysaiya śuḍa.
śuḍa ttaurai jsā dūkhū nau pāra gaula hvīra:

q.p: (1) They make (his?) limbs ... let them not seize the stick! Then ask the *faithful little ..., (2) they will beat him (with) the stick. Chaugalakai’s(?) limbs ... so they do not afterward (3) beat him (with) the stick (and) and there will be no pain for him.
(Your) dear one(?) went to you to the city of Shazhou. Help us, (4) O Chinese as well as Khotanese! (?) When he finds a way here to Ganzhou, for you, by that (5) help, you will obtain great bodhi.
There were many men. For a while(?) (6) in the world(?) at night (my) filled mind (was) not bound (= fixed?). One night I fixed my mind upon you (?). (7) ...

note.p: On the back of Chinese Mahāprajñāpāramitā (Giles no. 761).

q.p: (1) And thus he(?) completed bodhi.
(2) ... now to you ...

q.l: || khu ttyāṃ gaḍanau pajsa kṣamī. jastyāṃ bęysāṃ u bauda
: khu ttyāṃ gäḍąṇau pajsaṃ kṣamī. jastyāṃ beʾysāṃ u
baudhasatvāṃ aurga tsvą̄ñai u śakrra jastaṣau a-
ysūrāṃ āstanä mistą hauvanau raudāṃ. dā jsa haphva
ttyāṃ harabaiśa ą̄rga tsvauñai vasvą-varą̄hauʾ parī-
yastāṃ jsa va dīda nva padaṃjä bīsai ṣiʾ pūsai khu
au vaña īmījsū ttyau gaḍanāṃ jsa ttu pvaisai pvaisū
hīye nva kṣama khva ma aysmya-ṃ ṣṭāvai na śuka hī-.
yi jīyį udaśāya. khu au ttū pvaisū khva masa
hąmą̄ve naiṣkaista-ṃ jsa vā paraya-ṃ uysdīśai

q.p: (4) If it pleases (one) to do homage to these *teachers [BSkt. gaḍin?], then one should go in reverence to the lord buddhas and (5) the bodhisattvas, and to Śakra, the sons of gods, (6) the asuras, and the other great mighty kings. Equipped with the Law, one should should go in reverence (7) to all these.

Together with the noble ones of pure morals (śīla) (8) there ... the one dwelling according to the method, ask him(?). If (9) now today, he were to ask those gaḍanas, I ask (10) according to (my) own wish, according as it may be here in my mind, not solely (11) for the sake of my life, if I ask that, however great (12) it may be, deign to teach me in detail(?).

q.l: uca hīvī vā pina paka hīyį vā ṣī tha-ṃ pasta-ṃ
devatta: śade jsa vā vīśuʾ dā na naraume cū būr-e
kṣamī tt-e baiśa nva aysmūi hamāre: auʾską aunā
kaidä āysdiḍā dījsą̄re cū būra caidā nva kṣam-e
ttā naiṣkalīda: ttī ttye nva pvaisai tsvai jaste baiśa nva
aysmūi āvama habairīda uską̄tta bīsā vā jsāṃ
kaiʾda khvai japha na hamāre u haiʾvai hame: ha-
rabeś-e hīra hvaracī hamāre khu ttī maṇḍai kaiṇa-ṃ
pvaisā ttī va by(au)da pasta-ṃ u ttī haḍa asta śarka

q.p: (14) the ... of water ... (15) the deity. From the earth evil fire does not come out hither. As much as (16) it may please you, those all will be according to your mind. Those dwelling up above (17) will look after (you) and keep (you) guarded. However much yoy may think according to wish, (18) they will explain it to you.

Then I ask to go(?) accordingly. All gods, according to (19) (his) mind, will fulfill his wishes. Those dwelling up above (20) will look after us so that they(?) have no quarrels and there will be *excellence for him. (21) All things will be *propitious for him.
If you should ask me/them then *for a woman, (22) then *he deigned find one(?), but then *the servant girl is pretty(?).

note.p: On the back of Chinese Prajñāpāramitā. Hoernle, MR., pp. 395-99, pl. xxii (from H. 142-143, see Introduction pp. xl, xli, xliii). IOL Khot 32/8 is the right part of lines 5-7; IOL Khot 215/18-19 may also belong to this text. It corresponds to the text in P 2787.12-15, which Bailey had already compared with this text (KT II, pp. 101-2). Unusual superscript and adscript vowel mark.

dāṃdä ʾīde || biśą̄nä sarvasatvānä uysnaurą̄ṇä su -i /

/ x mahāyāṃ dā pvāñä ttye padaṃjä jsai mīai āna mara mähä ʾī haḍā pvāʾrä u
baʾ]ysų̄śtāṣṭä baʾysų̄ñä aysmū upevārä : u baʾysą̄ña baʾysūśtā[ṣṭä
baʾ]ysą̄ña baʾysūśta varā[ṣṭ]ä -ā́ x vaṣṭa uvāra pra [x x x x]
/ x ʾī haḍā saṃbajī [x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x]
/ īyą̄näWith independent ī-. ttye ttädr[ām- x x x x x x x x x x x x x x]
We go to the refuge [of the Buddha]. We go to the refuge of the Law. [We go to the refuge of the] *bhikṣusaṅgha.
... toward the best bodhi of the buddhas, ... of the buddhas ...
... have ...-ed. [for?] the happiness of all living beings ...
... Speak [thus]: As the buddha mind is produced as many ...
... we hear ... more than all those living beings better ...
... we think with a pure [mind?] ... we ... [We avoid] all the great sins [and
turn ... the three-fold by the body, the four-fold [by] the tongue, [the three-fold by the mind, like they said to you first].
Thus a second, thus a third ... Speak thus: As ... [may be, we do homage to him].
For the sake of hearing the [profound paramārtha (and)] the Law of the Buddha we have taken up this restraint.
... the buddhadharma ... with fulfilled wish all living beings ...
*Speak [thus]: May we become buddhas! The bījapada should be spoken. As many
... who now toward us ... Hail to the profound paramārtha, the Law of the triyānas
... they may hear, with pure, concentrated mind, all ... beings
... the Law of the Mahayana should be heard, so in that way may they hear us here today and
... they may generate the buddha mind toward bodhi, and ... toward the bodhi of the buddhas.
... toward the bodhi of the buddhas ... exalted ...

q.p: [1] baiʾysa ārva jsą̄manai : dā ārva tsvą̄manai || bīsaga (8) ārava tsāmanai : cu drraina raṃną̄na ārava tsvāṃdū : ma na ttā drrąyvā miʾśtą̄ avā(9)yvā ysatha na nāsą̄manai vīnau prraṇaʾhaunau : tta hvāñara dā khū ṣṭā vaysña mahai (10) ttū namauna gabhīra beʾysāṃ dą̄ [5] pvāmanai ttā būrai harbīśāṃ sarvasatta ūysnaurau (11) hastara avai¬staivīnai haura hvarau vīra pūṣa paśau są̄ [6] na jvai na mañā na vīhīlā (12) dasāṃ maiśtā baśdāṃʾ jsa pathīsāṃ dasau ra maista śalai samādā [7] yī varttāṃ drrai-pa(13)dya ttaradararna tcą̄-padya bīśāʾna drrai-padya aysmūna khū tta paḍāna hvāṃdū [8] tta śeʾ(14)na tta d(r)aina ūvai. tta hvą̄ñara sa khū ṣṭā vaysña mahai ttye namāṃ gabhīra paramārtha [9] baiʾ(15)ysāṃ dā pvāme keʾṇaʾ ttu parāhiʾ nāṃdū tta sabajī ttyāṃ pūñā kūśala-mulyä jsa khū (16) ma ra satsaira tsą̄manai [10] ma na ttā raṣṭa-haspyīsākyau avarajsa-bvą̄myau. sabūttyāṃ (17) pīsau kaḍą̄ṇa¬maittrāṃ jsa hāysa na kaśą̄manai ma ttā bęysūña [11] aysmū paną̄śą̄(18)manai ma mvaiśda ū ma prraṇąʾhauną ttū ra ttā jsā gabīra paramārtha beʾysāṃ dā bīśvā (19) [12] bāḍvā bīśvą̄ ysathvą̄ āryāmaiʾttrai jasta beʾysa paḍauysą̄ña jsa ttarṣṭaṃdā sau(20)mūhāṃ jastāṃ beysauʾ jsa. beʾysūñuā parṣatta-maṇḍalvā ṣṭāna pītcīra pīchaṣṭū pya(21)ṣṭa yāḍa yiną̄mąnai ū vyachai vamasyai bīśū vara auna habīrāṃdai [13] kṣautta būma (22) pāraumai ū baudhadharma habaḍa āvana beʾśa sarvąsatta ūysnaura [14] ysamaśadya beʾ(23)ysa hamāṃdai tta pā hamīḍaka gą̄ṭhā dharma-śravaṇīʾya avīrmāttama beʾysā(24)na beʾysūśta bausta hamye hamaumanai || (25) brrāhmą cūttara-vīdha pauṇyą kalpa svarga prrimādyattai asakṣaittram asapūauṇyi bą̄hyana bījana yathā bīja 30 ||

“This much should be bought: From Kala(?) *four ...”

q.l: “75 kūsas of wheat was taken away.”
“89 kūsas and 7 ṣaṃgas of barley was taken away.”

q.l: || tta buri hvaṃḍä cu ṣau aśaukä hīvya ūtca nāṃdä || branaṃdä dayaṃ ganaṃ kūsa 30 || ʾīrvapųñä ganaṃ kūsa 10 2 || śāysajaṃgä ganaṃ kūsa 7 kha 5
|| mą̄mattī ūtci 2 ganaṃ kūsa 60 —— || bākakä ganaṃ kūsa 20 2 kha 5 || śūranä ganaṃ kūsa 10 5 —— || ayaśä ganaṃ kūsa 7 kha 5
|| māsa ganaṃ kūsa 30 —— || vilä ganaṃ kūsa 30 —— || daṃbą̄ saṃgapuñä kūsa 7 kha 5

q.p: The following were the men who received the ṣau Aśauka’s water:
Branaṃda Dayaṃ wheat — 30 kūsas. Īrvapųña wheat — 12 kūsas.
Śāysajaṃga wheat — 7 kūsas 5 khas. Mą̄mattī — 2 waters — wheat — 60 kūsas.
Bākaka wheat — 22 kūsas 5 khas. Śūrana wheat 15 kūsas. — Ayaśa wheat — 7 kūsas 5 khas.
Māsa wheat — 30 kūsas. Vila wheat — 30 kūsas. Daṃbą̄ Saṃgapuña wheat — 7 kūsas 5 khas.

q.l: / tti vā ṣau ysākadä hīvya ūtca nāṃdä || saṃganaṃdä ganaṃ kūsa 10 5 — || kharakä ganaṃ kūsa 30 ——
saṃgadattä ganaṃ kūsa 7 kha 5 —— || ʾīrvapuñä ganaṃ kūsa 30 —— || ʾīrasaṃgä ganaṃ kūsa 30 5 kha 5
braṃgalä ganaṃ kūsa 7 kha 5 —— || virsa vipuladattä kūsa 30

q.p: And the following received the ṣau Ysākada’s water:
Saṃganaṃda wheat — 15 kūsas. Kharaka wheat — 30 kūsas. Saṃgadatta wheat — 7 kūsas 5 khas. Īrvapuña wheat — 30 kūsas. Īrasaṃga wheat — 35 kūsas 5 khas. Braṃgala wheat — 7 kūsas 5 khas.
Virsa Vipuladatta — 30 kūsas.

q.p: The following (were) the men who owed barley:
Je- ... kūsas. Ma- 4 kūsas. Jsajsa Puṣonara 4 kūsas. Bakänai 3 kūsas. Eʾsa 2 kūsas. -tkula 3 kūsas.
Kū- *Karmadāya 4 kūsas. Saṣīka 3 kūsas. Väbisa 4 kūsas ... khas. Sulaña 2 kūsas.
Sabuda 2 kūsas 5 khas. ... 3 kūsas. *Ghanäśka 1 kūsa 5 khas. The reverend Suryakudra 2 kūsas.
-kūla 2 kūsas 4 khas. *Arrvabuda 2 kūsas. *Baṃvāra 3 kūsas. -oka 3 kūsas. Tcaṃbaka 1 kūsa 5 khas. *Bu x jsaṃgula 3 kūsas.

q.l: 2 kūsas of wheat. In the month of Siṃjsīja
he requested (it). He carried to the town 3 ...
1 kūsa of wheat, 1 kūsa of millet.
In the month of Haṃdyaja he received 5 khas of wheat.

note.p: OKhot.? Piece broken in two between lines 2 and 3.

q.p: (The following) paid so much tax:
Saṃga’s wife paid 100 mūrās. Sala’s wife paid 204 mūrās. *Rą̄’s wife paid 212 mūrās.
Jsajsaka’s wife paid 100 mūrās. Saṃpīka’s wife paid 55 mūrās.
.. so much ... (as?) tax one ...

note.p: Writing almost completely rubbed off, but parts of akṣaras are still legible.

“... promised payment in grain for work(?) ...”

note.p: Scroll from Dunhuang. Lines 1–12 Chinese-Khotanese phrasebook, cf. Or.8210/S. 5212.1-8 (Takata, 1988, pp. 204-06); lines 13-81 versified letter; lines 82-90 Saddharmapuṇḍarīka-sūtra; lines 92-164, b1-5 letter.
